title: Immune-Related Adverse Events for Endocrine Toxicities - Diabetes Mellitus
desc: The Immune-Related Adverse Events for Endocrine Toxicities - Diabetes Mellitus grades severity of hyperglycemia secondary to immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy.

orgreference.text: Brahmer JR, Lacchetti C, Schneider BJ, et al. Management of Immune-Related Adverse Events in Patients Treated With Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor Therapy: American Society of Clinical Oncology Clinical Practice Guideline. J Clin Oncol. 2018;36(17):1714-1768.

data.evidence:
Criteria

Hyperglycemia grade

Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; fasting glucose value >160 mg/dL (>8.9 mmol/L); no evidence of ketosis or laboratory evidence of T1DM 

G1

Moderate symptoms, able to perform ADLs, fasting glucose value >160-250 mg/dL (>8.9-13.9 mmol/L), ketosis or evidence of T1DM at any glucose level

G2

Severe symptoms, medically significant or life-threatening consequences, unable to perform ADLs; fasting glucose level >250-500 mg/dL (>13.9-27.8 mmol/L) 

G3

Severe symptoms, medically significant or life-threatening consequences, unable to perform ADLs; fasting glucose level >500 mg/dL (>27.8 mmol/L) 

G4

See Next Steps for details on management.
